Another point in which Juvenal and Tacitus in the main coincide is their indignation against the delatores‚· a pest which has had its analogues under every tyranny. At Rmne it assumed a peculiar form owing to several circumstances, of which the most important were the hypocrisy of the Caesars in ’ retaining the forms of a republic and the absence of any system of state police.
